channel.title: Deleting My Tracks on SoundCloud
channel.description:
Yes, I’m back at it again with deleting my songs from SoundCloud, cause I can’t afford the Pro Plan. ¯\_(ᐛ)_/¯
[details="Songs deleted from SoundCloud "] Go For It Epsilon VIP 1. Fun Times And Bad Memories 2. We’re Resilient 3. Unwanted Chaos 4. Looking Back Marmalade Remix [/details]
These songs deleted can be still heard on my [Bandlab](https://www.bandlab.com/ekstrakofficial) and my [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/3yGHlfCop3TDHOBT6MRA8Z?si=eb4bgxZ7Su2vQtC88or6mQ) .

item.title: Deleting My Tracks on SoundCloud
item.dc:creator: facade
item.description:
make a second account and upload them there, then just repost them on your main account (i’d suggest making an individual playlist for each song you upload on the second account, it gets people’s attention way more than a simple repost would)

Read full topic

item.title: Deleting My Tracks on SoundCloud
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
Free - 3 hrs
Pro - 6 hrs
Pro Unlimited - No time limit (duh)

HTH

item.title: Deleting My Tracks on SoundCloud
item.dc:creator: Polar
item.description:
It’s a time like limit rather than a song limit. I think you can have errrrr 2-3 hours of content or something like that.

Read full topic

item.title: Deleting My Tracks on SoundCloud
item.dc:creator: PISTOL
item.description:
Out of curiosity what’s the maximum songs you can have on SC?

Read full topic

item.title: Deleting My Tracks on SoundCloud
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
Private tracks still come out of your time allowance, so it doesn’t help if you’re running low on time/space.

Free SC accounts don’t count/limit the number of tracks you have. They limit the total minutes of all tracks on that account, whether they’re Public or Private.

Read full topic

item.title: Deleting My Tracks on SoundCloud
item.dc:creator: INDIR3CT
item.description:
Instead of deleting all tracks, why not just make them private? 1. It makes the track completly invisible, and takes away 1 from the number of tracks you have (just like you deleted it! But you didn’t . 2. If someone asks for that track, you can always just send a private soundcloud link to them, so they listen and even comment on it!

Anywho yeah

Read full topic

item.title: Deleting My Tracks on SoundCloud
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
Fwiw, rather than deleting tracks entirely (especially those that you feel are good enough for a distributed release - e.g. Spotify), consider replacing the SC version with a short teaser and adding a link to the Spotify version in the description.

It should help free up some time on SC while still having your best material promoted there.

Read full topic
